==Juuken Club==
==Juuken Club==
The {{nihongo|Juuken Club|æå£é¨|JÅ«kenbu}} is a group created by Shin Natsume to unite the last members of the Katana group and allow them to enter the Election Tournament. The initial formation was Shin Natsume, Mitsuomi Takayanagi, Bunshichi Tawara, Maya Natsume, and Kagesada Sugano. Two years after, lead by Maya, the club became the main opposition to the Enforcement Group.
The {{nihongo|Juuken Club|æå£é¨|JÅ«kenbu}} is a group created by Shin Natsume to unite the last members of the Katana group and allow them to enter the Election Tournament. The initial formation was Shin Natsume, Mitsuomi Takayanagi, Bunshichi Tawara, Maya Natsume, and Kagesada Sugano. Two years after, lead by Maya, the club became the main opposition to the Enforcement Group.

: Vice-captain of the Juuken Club. When people first meet this third-year student, most are shocked and often confuse him with an [[Greys|extraterrestrial]] because of the size and shape of his eyes, and the fact that he makes misleading sounds when sucking on his juice box. He is very intelligent, respectful, and is knowledgeable concerning technology.
: Vice-captain of the Juuken Club. When people first meet this third-year student, most are shocked and often confuse him with an [[Greys|extraterrestrial]] because of the size and shape of his eyes, and the fact that he makes misleading sounds when sucking on his juice box. He is very intelligent, respectful, and is knowledgeable concerning technology.

;{{nihongo |[[Kagesada Sugano]]|èé å½±å®|Sugano Kagesada}}
: An original member of the Juuken Club, but was forced to join by Maya. A third-year student, he is better known by his nickname ''Asshat'' (or ''Scum'' in the anime) that was given to him by one of the teachers. During the Election Tournament, he remained hidden with Bunshichi and let Maya, Mitsuomi, and Shin do the fighting. He remained a member, although an inactive one, until Souichiro and Bob asked him to rejoin them in their cause. Though not as strong as other students in the school, he will use devious tactics in order to win. After Shin's death, he put himself through intense physical training to become stronger. Even though he is extremely perverted, he has several bodyguard girlfriends named ''The Sugano Bodyguard''. He took the role of Advanced Guard for the Juuken Club in the 3rd round of the recent Election Tournament.
: An original member of the Juuken Club, but was forced to join by Maya. A third-year student, he is better known by his nickname ''Asshat'' (or ''Scum'' in the anime) that was given to him by one of the teachers. During the Election Tournament, he remained hidden with Bunshichi and let Maya, Mitsuomi, and Shin do the fighting. He remained a member, although an inactive one, until Souichiro and Bob asked him to rejoin them in their cause. Though not as strong as other students in the school, he will use devious tactics in order to win. After Shin's death, he put himself through intense physical training to become stronger. Even though he is extremely perverted, he has several bodyguard girlfriends named ''The Sugano Bodyguard''. He took the role of Advanced Guard for the Juuken Club in the 3rd round of the recent Election Tournament.
<br style="clear:both">

Line 52: Line 45:
The Enforcement Group (å·è¡é¨, ''ShikÅbu'') is the main force among the students of Todou Academy, they keep the order on the school and punish the students that do not follow their rules. The Enforcement Group is chosen annually by the Election Tournament, where the winning group becomes the new Enforcement Group for the next school term. Two years ago, Mitsuomi became the leader of the group and his group won the next, keeping their post.
The Enforcement Group (å·è¡é¨, ''ShikÅbu'') is the main force among the students of Todou Academy, they keep the order on the school and punish the students that do not follow their rules. The Enforcement Group is chosen annually by the Election Tournament, where the winning group becomes the new Enforcement Group for the next school term. Two years ago, Mitsuomi became the leader of the group and his group won the next, keeping their post.

Line 71: Line 61:
;Sakon Shima
;Sakon Shima
â
:Leader of the 1st division of the Enforcement Group. He appears very late in the series after the start of the tournament and suggests a night attack on the Juuken Club when they split up for the night. He says the idea came from lower level members of the Enforcement Group's desire to crush the Juuken Club. The plan is rejected by Bunshichi who suggests Sakon just quell the desire of the lower level members to attack the Juuken Club before the finals. He later runs into Masataka on accident, who refers to Sakon as a commanding officer in the Enforcement group.
+
:Leader of the 1st division of the Enforcement Group. He appears very late in the series after the start of the tournament and suggests a night attack on the Juuken Club when they split up for the night. He says the idea came from lower level members of the Enforcement Group's desire to crush the Juuken Club. The plan is rejected by Bunshichi who suggests Sakon just quell the desire of the lower level members to attack the Juuken Club before the finals. He later runs into Masataka on accident, who refers to Sakon as a commanding officer in the Enforcement group

;{{nihongo |[[ShirÅ Tagami]]|ç°ä¸ å£«é|Tagami ShirÅ}}
:Third-year student and leader of the 3rd division group of the Enforcement Group. He proclaims himself "the last samurai", following [[bushido]]. Being a gentleman, he despises cowardly ways of fighting. His style of fighting is using a hybrid [[bÅ]] that can turn into a [[sansetsukon]]. When fighting, he is very violent, but he does not take pleasure in hurting his enemies. As a samurai, he seeks for strong opponents and feels honored for fighting against them. He is currently ranked 9th of the Todou Academy's strongest fighters and is the reserve of the Enforcement Group on the Election Tournament.
:Third-year student and leader of the 3rd division group of the Enforcement Group. He proclaims himself "the last samurai", following [[bushido]]. Being a gentleman, he despises cowardly ways of fighting. His style of fighting is using a hybrid [[bÅ]] that can turn into a [[sansetsukon]]. When fighting, he is very violent, but he does not take pleasure in hurting his enemies. As a samurai, he seeks for strong opponents and feels honored for fighting against them. He is currently ranked 9th of the Todou Academy's strongest fighters and is the reserve of the Enforcement Group on the Election Tournament.

:Third-year student and the leader of Mitsuomi's guard, he does not seem to care very much about Mitsuomi's safety, which normally causes Emi to get upset at him. Kagurazaka have a very effeminate look and, for this, is called [[transvestite]] by Isuzu. Little of his abilities were shown, and he only had an unfinished fight against Masataka, but his stats on Kurei's data apparently puts him on the same level as Isuzu.

Line 108: Line 92:
F is a group formed by the new leaders of the 12 Founding Families. The known members so far are: Ishiyumi, Tsumuji, Kabuto, Mawari, Kago and Kagiroi - it is known that a seventh member exists and is hinted to be Noriko Shindayuu Inue, but she may simply be a servant of SÅhaku Kago. There is also a possibility of other members that have not even been hinted at yet as we have yet to see a youth from the Hotaru or Wani families and the majority of the 36 branch families remain unknown. Although Mitsuomi is the leader of the Takayanagi family, the members of F answer solely to SÅhaku.
F is a group formed by the new leaders of the 12 Founding Families. The known members so far are: Ishiyumi, Tsumuji, Kabuto, Mawari, Kago and Kagiroi - it is known that a seventh member exists and is hinted to be Noriko Shindayuu Inue, but she may simply be a servant of SÅhaku Kago. There is also a possibility of other members that have not even been hinted at yet as we have yet to see a youth from the Hotaru or Wani families and the majority of the 36 branch families remain unknown. Although Mitsuomi is the leader of the Takayanagi family, the members of F answer solely to SÅhaku.
â
[[Image:Sohaku.jpg|thumb|right|100px|100px]]
 
;{{nihongo |[[SÅhaku Kago]]|å¯µ å®é­|Kago SÅhaku}}
;{{nihongo |[[SÅhaku Kago]]|å¯µ å®é­|Kago SÅhaku}}
: The first and only ever, head of the Kago family, the true leader of F, and the father of Souichiro Nagi. His power can infuse [[ki]] back into a lifeless body, reviving it from the dead. Through this means, SÅhaku seemingly "defies" death and has been alive for centuries. He also has the ability to store his consciousness in his right eye, allowing his soul to migrate to another body, when the eye is inserted into someone else's body. He has a habit of using people for his own means and getting rid of them when they are no longer useful to him. He has always been in conflict with the other founding families and is often responsible for many of their deaths. For some reason, he wants to awaken powers in people across the world using the Red Wing Resonance Effect.
: The first and only ever, head of the Kago family, the true leader of F, and the father of Souichiro Nagi. His power can infuse [[ki]] back into a lifeless body, reviving it from the dead. Through this means, SÅhaku seemingly "defies" death and has been alive for centuries. He also has the ability to store his consciousness in his right eye, allowing his soul to migrate to another body, when the eye is inserted into someone else's body. He has a habit of using people for his own means and getting rid of them when they are no longer useful to him. He has always been in conflict with the other founding families and is often responsible for many of their deaths. For some reason, he wants to awaken powers in people across the world using the Red Wing Resonance Effect.
<br style="clear:both">
<br style="clear:both">
â
[[Image:Noriko.JPG|thumb|right|100px|100px]]
 
;{{nihongo |[[Noriko Shindayuu Inue]]|ç¬æ± æ°å¤ªå¤« å¸å­|Inue ShindayÅ« Noriko}}
;{{nihongo |[[Noriko Shindayuu Inue]]|ç¬æ± æ°å¤ªå¤« å¸å­|Inue ShindayÅ« Noriko}}
: A [[Shinto]] priestess and one of SÅhaku's most trusted subordinates. Her power, the ''Dragon Roar'', allows her to control anotherâs body, but the owner of the body can still make subconscious movements. She has lived for centuries, due to SÅhakuâs power to defy death. She is often entrusted with SÅhakuâs experiments and seems to have a very possessive love (or adoration) towards him. She is also the one that is delegated to obtain a new body for him if/when his old one is destroyed.
: A [[Shinto]] priestess and one of SÅhaku's most trusted subordinates. Her power, the ''Dragon Roar'', allows her to control anotherâs body, but the owner of the body can still make subconscious movements. She has lived for centuries, due to SÅhakuâs power to defy death. She is often entrusted with SÅhakuâs experiments and seems to have a very possessive love (or adoration) towards him. She is also the one that is delegated to obtain a new body for him if/when his old one is destroyed.
<br style="clear:both">
<br style="clear:both">
â
[[Image:Tetsuhito kagiroi.JPG|thumb|right|85px|85px]]
 
;{{ nihongo |[[Tetsuhito Kagiroi]] |ç¬ éäºº| Kagiroi Tetsuhito}}
;{{ nihongo |[[Tetsuhito Kagiroi]] |ç¬ éäºº| Kagiroi Tetsuhito}}
: The current head of the Kagiroi family and one of SÅhakuâs most trusted subordinates. His mother was destroyed by SÅhaku when he was still in her womb, but he survived. The women in his family had a tradition of drinking iron sand, and did so without being poisoned. This eventually led to the characteristic of their skin and blood being impervious to iron, and the creation of the iron fist attack. Because of SÅhaku's power to defy death, he has been living for centuries. When SÅhakuâs experiment with Makiko Nagi was unsuccessful, Tetsuhito was transplanted with her eye. This allowed him to open multiple dragon gates and use multiple powers she had absorbed. It is revealed during his fight with Maya Natsume that his ki is visible when traveling throughout his body. This provided Maya with some indication what power he would use next. When he loses Makiko's eye that regulates his powers in his fight with Maya, his power goes out of control. He is eventually defeated and was killed by Maya when the Reiki's true form and power was activated.
: The current head of the Kagiroi family and one of SÅhakuâs most trusted subordinates. His mother was destroyed by SÅhaku when he was still in her womb, but he survived. The women in his family had a tradition of drinking iron sand, and did so without being poisoned. This eventually led to the characteristic of their skin and blood being impervious to iron, and the creation of the iron fist attack. Because of SÅhaku's power to defy death, he has been living for centuries. When SÅhakuâs experiment with Makiko Nagi was unsuccessful, Tetsuhito was transplanted with her eye. This allowed him to open multiple dragon gates and use multiple powers she had absorbed. It is revealed during his fight with Maya Natsume that his ki is visible when traveling throughout his body. This provided Maya with some indication what power he would use next. When he loses Makiko's eye that regulates his powers in his fight with Maya, his power goes out of control. He is eventually defeated and was killed by Maya when the Reiki's true form and power was activated.
<br style="clear:both">
<br style="clear:both">
â
[[Image:Katsumi.JPG|thumb|right|100px|100px]]
 
;{{nihongo |[[Katsumi Kabuto]]|å åç¾|Kabuto Katsumi}}
;{{nihongo |[[Katsumi Kabuto]]|å åç¾|Kabuto Katsumi}}
: The current head of the Kabuto family. He acted as SÅhakuâs assistant and supervised the operation to retrieve the computer chip at Enmi's shrine. When the operation failed, he agreed to fight with Souichiro to redeem himself, but since the fight was never shown, his power was never revealed. After his defeat he made a deal with Souichiro that if Souichiro freed him, he would help him escape SÅhakuâs compound. He was last seen meeting Tessen, who immediately killed him.
: The current head of the Kabuto family. He acted as SÅhakuâs assistant and supervised the operation to retrieve the computer chip at Enmi's shrine. When the operation failed, he agreed to fight with Souichiro to redeem himself, but since the fight was never shown, his power was never revealed. After his defeat he made a deal with Souichiro that if Souichiro freed him, he would help him escape SÅhakuâs compound. He was last seen meeting Tessen, who immediately killed him.
<br style="clear:both">
<br style="clear:both">
â
[[Image:Jushi mataza tsumuji.JPG|thumb|right|95px|95px]]
 
;{{nihongo |[[Jushi Mataza Tsumuji]]|é¢¯ åå·¦ éå­|Tsumuji Mataza JÅ«shi}}
;{{nihongo |[[Jushi Mataza Tsumuji]]|é¢¯ åå·¦ éå­|Tsumuji Mataza JÅ«shi}}
: The illegitimate son of Yorihira Mataza Tsumuji, the former leader of the Tsumuji family, and a member of the Shukyou family (a branch of the Kabane family, one of the red feather families of the Flying Phoenix). Because of his mother's being poor to the point of working as a [[prostitute]] and his red feather blood, Jushi was despised by his half-brother, the legitimate heir of the Tsumuji family, Yorimasa Mataza Tsumuji, who constantly assaulted and humiliated him. One day, an enraged Jushi tried to kill his brother, only being stopped by his father, who broke his spear. A large fragment of the spear penetrated into Mataza's right eye and was stuck into his brain. This activated the power of the Shukyou family, the ''Dragon Claw'', that was instantly used to slice Yorimasa's right leg. Years later, Mataza grew to become the sadistic leader of the Tsumuji family, after a [[coup d'Ã©tat]] on his father. He learned to hate his power and anything related to the red feathers, developing a style of combat based on eight mechanical arms and spears. He loved to torture his enemies, who he views as insects. During his fight against Souichiro, his mechanical arms were disabled and destroyed, so he decided to use his Dragon Claw. After devouring Jushi's power, Souichiro was tainted by his immense hatred, going berserk. Saved by his father from death, the both have apparently restored their relationship.
: The illegitimate son of Yorihira Mataza Tsumuji, the former leader of the Tsumuji family, and a member of the Shukyou family (a branch of the Kabane family, one of the red feather families of the Flying Phoenix). Because of his mother's being poor to the point of working as a [[prostitute]] and his red feather blood, Jushi was despised by his half-brother, the legitimate heir of the Tsumuji family, Yorimasa Mataza Tsumuji, who constantly assaulted and humiliated him. One day, an enraged Jushi tried to kill his brother, only being stopped by his father, who broke his spear. A large fragment of the spear penetrated into Mataza's right eye and was stuck into his brain. This activated the power of the Shukyou family, the ''Dragon Claw'', that was instantly used to slice Yorimasa's right leg. Years later, Mataza grew to become the sadistic leader of the Tsumuji family, after a [[coup d'Ã©tat]] on his father. He learned to hate his power and anything related to the red feathers, developing a style of combat based on eight mechanical arms and spears. He loved to torture his enemies, who he views as insects. During his fight against Souichiro, his mechanical arms were disabled and destroyed, so he decided to use his Dragon Claw. After devouring Jushi's power, Souichiro was tainted by his immense hatred, going berserk. Saved by his father from death, the both have apparently restored their relationship.
<br style="clear:both">
<br style="clear:both">
â
[[Image:Tessen ishiyumi.JPG|thumb|right|85px|85px]]
 
;{{nihongo |[[Tessen Ishiyumi]]|ç©¹ æ¤ä»|Ishiyumi Tessen}}
;{{nihongo |[[Tessen Ishiyumi]]|ç©¹ æ¤ä»|Ishiyumi Tessen}}
: The head of the Ishiyumi family, Tessen proved to be one of Mitsuomi's most loyal subordinates. Tessen normally keeps a level-head, and good humor about himself. However, his resolve to place Mitsuomi in power makes him a fearsome combatant. As he refers to Emi Izumi and ShirÅ Tagami to Mitsuomi's Sword & Shield, Tessen analogizes himself to an arrow, who will stop at nothing until he pierces his prey. The nature of his chakra is that of the 2nd Dragon Gate - the Looping Orange Water Dragon. With this chakra activated, he can manipulate water sources into various forms; most commonly he uses water droplets as bullets. After their initial confrontation, Souichiro sealed Tessen's Dragon Gate, disabling his chakra. The revelation left such a lasting traumatic impact that he became a borderline-sociopath, with the one goal of retrieving what once was his. The extent of his madness drove him to vengeance, and even murder, on just about anyone who mocked his loss. Former F comrade, Katsumi Kabuto, paid the ultimate price for his folly with a barrage of hundreds of darts. But a turning point for Tessen came in his eventual meeting with Souichiro, which escalated into full-blown mortal combat. The intervention of Maya and Mitsuomi spared both from potentially killing one another. It was here that Mitsuomi restored Tessen to his former state of mind after learning how SÅhaku could open his Dragon Gate once again. Tessen's current condition and whereabouts are unknown as of this point.
: The head of the Ishiyumi family, Tessen proved to be one of Mitsuomi's most loyal subordinates. Tessen normally keeps a level-head, and good humor about himself. With this chakra activated, he can manipulate water sources into various forms; most commonly he uses water droplets as bullets. After their initial confrontation, Souichiro sealed Tessen's Dragon Gate, disabling his chakra. The extent of his madness drove him to vengeance, and even murder, on just about anyone who mocked his loss. Former F comrade, Katsumi Kabuto, paid the ultimate price for his folly with a barrage of hundreds of darts. The intervention of Maya and Mitsuomi spared both from potentially killing one another. It was here that Mitsuomi restored Tessen to his former state of mind after learning how SÅhaku could open his Dragon Gate once again. Tessen's current condition and whereabouts are unknown as of this point.

;{{ nihongo |[[Madoka Mawari]]|å å|Mawari Madoka}}
: She is the current head of the Mawari family and was a member of F; her specialty is fencing. She was under SÅhakuâs jutsu that was maintained through an amulet on her necklace. This jutsu reduced the pain she felt in battle and also made her believe that she was in love with SÅhaku, even though he was the one who killed her parents. She was sent to retrieve the computer chip from the Juuken club. She proved to be very determined until the jutsu was broken when Aya destroyed the amulet. Afterwards, she is proven to be a caring middle school student that is willing to help the Juuken club in any way. During the time with the Juuken club, she has taken a liking to Masataka, though he is painfully unaware of her affections.
: She is the current head of the Mawari family and was a member of F; her specialty is fencing. She was under SÅhakuâs jutsu that was maintained through an amulet on her necklace. Afterwards, she is proven to be a caring middle school student that is willing to help the Juuken club in any way. During the time with the Juuken club, she has taken a liking to Masataka, though he is painfully unaware of her affections.

;{{nihongo |[[Reiki (Tenjho Tenge)|Reiki]]|é¶æ¯|Reiki}}
;{{nihongo |[[Reiki (Tenjho Tenge)|Reiki]]|é¶æ¯|Reiki}}
: A ceremonial [[nodachi]] that was used to entrap all the power of the evil Buddhist ceremonies. Its powers are reliant on the person wielding it, thus, causing the user to go on a killing spree, or to a non-power user just be a long katana. While a power user holds it, it often activates their power and regulates it. When it is activated by a power user it uses large amounts of ki. Because of this, some power users lose control and are left fighting with their own powers. During this time they have been known to become increasingly cruel to the person they are fighting against. Later on it is revealed the sword has a spirit of its own that can manifest itself, with the help of Ayaâs dragon eyes. It claimed that once Aya knew everything, they will merge and together be the katana for the person who will break the chains of fate.
: A ceremonial [[nodachi]] that was used to entrap all the power of the evil Buddhist ceremonies. Its powers are reliant on the person wielding it, thus, causing the user to go on a killing spree, or to a non-power user just be a long katana. While a power user holds it, it often activates their power and regulates it. When it is activated by a power user it uses large amounts of ki. Because of this, some power users lose control and are left fighting with their own powers. During this time they have been known to become increasingly cruel to the person they are fighting against. Later on it is revealed the sword has a spirit of its own that can manifest itself, with the help of Ayaâs dragon eyes. It claimed that once Aya knew everything, they will merge and together be the katana for the person who will break the chains of fate.

: She is a member of the Rikudou family, which is a branch of the Kago family. She also happens to be one of Sohaku confidants. She possesses the Koushin Dragon's Gate, which allows her to infuse parasite insects with her own ki. <ref name=" Koushin Dragon's Gate "> "Tenjho Tenge" Manga; volume 17 [[tankÅbon]] (Chapter 103, Page 110). </ref> She then has the insects inserted into the host body. Afterwards she can control the host and make them exert immense amount of power until the insectâs ki is exhausted and her insects die. She is known by the Enforcement group and according to Jushi Mataza Tsumuji, her power is also important to Mitsuomiâs plan. <ref name="the plan"> "Tenjho Tenge" Manga; volume 17 [[tankÅbon]] (Chapter 103, Page 111). </ref> This plan involves a condensing the ki to bring forth "the true warrior".
: She is a member of the Rikudou family, which is a branch of the Kago family. She also happens to be one of Sohaku confidants. She possesses the Koushin Dragon's Gate, which allows her to infuse parasite insects with her own ki. <ref name=" Koushin Dragon's Gate "> "Tenjho Tenge" Manga; volume 17 [[tankÅbon]] (Chapter 103, Page 110). </ref> She then has the insects inserted into the host body. Afterwards she can control the host and make them exert immense amount of power until the insectâs ki is exhausted and her insects die. She is known by the Enforcement group and according to Jushi Mataza Tsumuji, her power is also important to Mitsuomiâs plan. <ref name="the plan"> "Tenjho Tenge" Manga; volume 17 [[tankÅbon]] (Chapter 103, Page 111). </ref> This plan involves a condensing the ki to bring forth "the true warrior".
Line 169: Line 142:
: The former head of the Tsumuji family and father of Jushi. He was first seen with the rest of the surviving former heads of families, when they were training Souichiro. Later, Souichiro and Aya run into him at the Enmi shrine, where he was looking for the computer chip. Once Aya helps him locate the chip, he took off because he did not want to get them involved. He maintains personal guilt for the way his son has turned out and believes that he alone should be the one to stop him. He blames himself so much that he even goes a far as trying to stabbing his own eyes (lost his left eye) as a way to atone for the sins his son has committed to the Enmi family. When Makiko was recoving, he was taking care of her in a remote hut in the mountains, but has returned to check out the activities of the Election Tournament.
: The former head of the Tsumuji family and father of Jushi. He was first seen with the rest of the surviving former heads of families, when they were training Souichiro. Later, Souichiro and Aya run into him at the Enmi shrine, where he was looking for the computer chip. Once Aya helps him locate the chip, he took off because he did not want to get them involved. He maintains personal guilt for the way his son has turned out and believes that he alone should be the one to stop him. He blames himself so much that he even goes a far as trying to stabbing his own eyes (lost his left eye) as a way to atone for the sins his son has committed to the Enmi family. When Makiko was recoving, he was taking care of her in a remote hut in the mountains, but has returned to check out the activities of the Election Tournament.
